author: DTNEXT Bureau
title: Chennai's suburbs face rain fury on Thursday as streets inundated, traffic flow hit, houses and shops flooded
text:
Chennai's suburbs face rain fury on Thursday as streets inundated, traffic flow hit, houses and shops flooded
Motorists say potholes on GST road are disaster in waiting; residents evacuate several places in Kancheepuram district
CHENNAI: Overnight rains followed by Thursday’s downpour flooded several suburban streets of Pallavaram, Chromepet, Tambaram, Irumbuliyur, Perungalathur, Pallavaram, and Anagaputhur, significantly affecting regular life.
The GST Road in Tambaram and Irumbuliyur was completely inundated, slowing down traffic, while potholes caused unassuming motorists to lose balance and fall, many of them sustaining injuries.
Karthikeyan, a resident of Tambaram, said the Highways department should have repaired small potholes on the national highway before the monsoon as lakhs of people use it every day. These potholes turn into death traps when it rains.
Traffic came to a crawl in Sholinganallur and Karapakkam areas as rains caused flooding on the Old Mahabalipuram Road.
On a swamped ECR, police along with Metro Rail workers were seen repairing clogged stormwater drains to release stagnant water from the road.
The Pallavaram-Anagaputhur Road, which comes under the Tambaram Corporation limit, was completely inundated. Rainwater entered houses and shops along the road, trapping their occupants for a while as they could not evacuate immediately. Residents said the corporation recently dug pits for underground drains, but did not close them properly, causing water to accumulate and overflow, entering houses nearby.
In Kancheepuram district, areas like Orikkai, Sevilimedu, Olimohamed Pettai, Nathapettai, Ponerikarai, Walajabad, and Sunguvachatiram received heavy rainfall. Several streets in low-lying areas were flooded, forcing residents to move to safe zones. Residents here said the corporation must be prepared with multiple plans to handle the monsoon better so that common people will not suffer every year.

author: IRATI PRAT
title: Portugal - Croacia: Cristiano Ronaldo no tiene límites - UEFA Nations League
text:
A rrancó la cuarta edición de la Nations League con victoria de Portugal sobre Croacia (2-1). Cristiano Ronaldo, que anotó su gol oficial número 901, se impuso a Luka Modric en Lisboa. El ariete de Al Nassr lideró el triunfo de la selección de Roberto Martínez en un buen partido de fútbol en el que se lucieron ambos porteros, Diogo Costa y Livakovic. Pero al final, una vez más, el que marcó las diferencias fue CR7.
Fue un primer tiempo precioso en Da Luz. El campo del Benfica, engalanado para despedir a Pepe, vio una buena imagen del equipo de Roberto Martínez. Necesario tras la eliminación en cuartos de la Eurocopa. Cristiano Ronaldo, que era titular, volvió a ser protagonista.
El homenaje a Pepe en Da Luz. EFE. Ya en el minuto 5 avisaron los de Roberto Martínez con un remate desde la frontal que sacó Livakovic e instantes después Dalot no perdonó tras un buen pase filtrado del jugador del Manchester United.
Modric, que era titular con los croatas teniendo absoluta libertad en la zona de mediapuntas, reaccionaba con un disparo que se perdía por poco. El partido escalaba en ocasiones. Cristiano se animaba y protagonizaba una gran jugada con Leao que paraba con el pie, a lo portero de balonmano, el arquero de Fenerbahçe. Portugal dominaba y aunque Croacia avisaba ante un buen Diogo Costa, el 2-0 acabó llegando.
El emotivo homenaje de la selección portuguesa a Pepe El gol 901 de Cristiano Ronaldo Fue de un Cristiano Ronaldo que firmó su gol 901. Semanas después de anotar el 900 con Al Nassr, el luso volvía a 'mojar'. Un buen remate con el interior a centro de Nuno Mendes desde el costado izquierdo. Croacia, sin embargo, como es habitual, se metió en el partido.
La emoción de Cristiano Ronaldo tras marcar ante Croacia. LAPRESSE. De una forma u otra, siempre están ahí. Y en esta ocasión, los balcánicos encontraron el 2-1 tras un remate de Borna Sosa que se metió Dalot en su portería. El gol en propia abría el encuentro... aunque Pedro Neto quiso silenciar la rebelión croata con una gran jugada individual que acabó en el larguero.
A partir de ahí el partido estuvo abierto. Croacia dominó y Portugal tuvo ocasiones, pero el resultado no se movió más. Cristiano Ronaldo, que cuajó un buen partido tanto a nivel goleador como asociativo (tuvo el 3-1 pero se lo sacó Livakovic con otra gran parada), se marchó ovacionado a cinco minutos del final en Da Luz. 10 minutos antes, también Modric se había ido al banquillo bajo aplausos.
Los minutos finales, no obstante, fueron para Croacia, que murió en la orilla. Matanovic tuvo varias ocasiones para haber hecho el empate pero los de Roberto Martínez resistieron. El próximo partido de Portugal será ante Escocia; el de Croacia, ante Polonia.

author: Karina Campos
title: Calor chega a 36°C aliado a baixa umidade do ar nesta sexta-feira em MS
text:
Um sistema de alta pressão inibe a formação de nuvens e chuva no Estado
Karina Campos | 02/08/2024 - 06:27 twitter [#154] Created with Sketch.
pinterest [#180] Created with Sketch.
Céu aberto em Campo Grande (Ana Laura Menegat, Midiamax)
A sexta-feira (2) em Mato Grosso do Sul será de sol, tempo firme e variação de nebulosidade. As temperaturas devem se manter acima da média, especialmente pela influência de um sistema de alta pressão atmosférica que impede a formação de nuvens e chuvas.
O tempo ainda está aliado a baixa umidade relativa do ar, entre 10 e 30%. Apesar da manhã gelada, de 18°C, haverá aumento gradual da temperatura, que pode chegar a amplitude térmica de 20°C, segundo o Cemtec (Centro de Monitoramento do Tempo e do Clima).
Campo Grande amanhece com mínima de 19°C e deve chegar a 34°C, sem chance de chuva e com baixa umidade do ar. As mínimas devem oscilar entre 18°C e 22°C nas regiões sul, leste e sudeste, enquanto as máximas podem alcançar 29°C a 34°C.
Nas regiões pantaneira e sudoeste, as mínimas estarão entre 23°C e 26°C e as máximas entre 34°C e 37°C. Já nas regiões norte e bolsão, as mínimas variam de 17°C a 21°C e as máximas de 32°C a 36°C.
Os ventos atuarão predominantemente das direções leste, nordeste e norte ao longo do dia, com intensidade variando entre 30 km/h e 50 km/h. Há possibilidade de rajadas de vento superiores a 50 km/h, especialmente no sábado (3) e domingo (4).
Contudo, a combinação de altas temperaturas, baixa umidade e ventos fortes, recomenda-se que a população evite atear fogo em vegetação ou materiais inflamáveis, e mantenha-se hidratada. A baixa umidade e as condições meteorológicas também podem afetar a qualidade do ar, que deve piorar nos próximos dias, impactando a saúde e o meio ambiente.

author: The Straits Times - Sports
title: Leader Norris chasing an F1 hat-trick in China | Nestia
text: FILE PHOTO: Formula One F1 - Australian Grand Prix - Albert Park Grand Prix Circuit, Melbourne, Australia - March 16, 2025 McLaren's Lando Norris celebrates with the trophy on the podium after winning the Australian Grand Prix along with second placed Red Bull's Max Verstappen and third placed Mercedes' George Russell REUTERS/Tracey Nearmy/File Photo

author: R. SEKARAN
title: Beruas MP has gone overboard with his statement, says Bersatu | The Star
text:
PETALING JAYA: Beruas DAP MP Datuk Ngeh Koo Ham has gone overboard with his proposal to include a non-Muslim in the special committee to look into the competency of the Selangor state assembly to draw up Islamic laws, says Wan Ahmad Fayshal Wan Ahmad Kamal ( pic ).
The Bersatu Youth chief said Ngeh's statement was shallow and ignorant of the Constitution.
"As a member of the Parliament, he should know that matters regarding Islam are under the purview of the Yang di-Pertuan Agong and the Malay Rulers.
"Syariah laws need to be discussed, managed and enforced by Muslims. It does not involve non-Muslims," he said in a statement on Friday (Dec 29).
Wan Ahmad Fayshal said Ngeh's proposal could create public uneasiness, especially among Muslims, if non-Muslims were involved in the process of drawing up Islamic laws, something which could be viewed as interfering in Islamic affairs.
"If Ngeh is really concerned about the competency of the state assembly to draw up Islamic laws, he can suggest Islamic experts.
"The committee has the approval of Sultan of Selangor Sultan Sharafuddin Idris Shah, who is the national council chairman of Malaysian Islamic Affairs.
"Work has already begun. As such Ngeh should withdraw his proposal and openly apologise," added Wan Ahmad Fayshal.
Open Modal ×

persons.name: wan ahmad fayshal wan ahmad kamal
